titleStmt.title: Greuous grones for the poore Done by a well-willer, who wisheth, that the poore of England might be so prouided for, as none should neede to go a begging within this realme.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A02255 of text S105876 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 12391). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 22 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 15 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Greuous grones for the poore Done by a well-willer, who wisheth, that the poore of England might be so prouided for, as none should neede to go a begging within this realme.
titleStmt.author: Sparke, Michael, d. 1653, attributed name.
Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by William Jaggard] for Michaell Sparke,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes misattributed to Michael Sparke and to Thomas Dekker.
The first leaf is blank; the final leaf contains verse.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
